reviews.text: My friend and I stayed here for 4 nights in November. The location is on a pedestrian street 1 block from the tram and about 4 blocks from the main attractions - Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque etc. The rooms were comfortable --- a reasonable size for European hotels, very clean and everything was in good working order. Excellent water pressure and hot water. The breakfast buffet was very good, although the pre-cooked eggs and sausage are cold. Opt for the cooked-to-order omelet. The staff were all wonderful - knowledgeable and friendly. We would definitely return and recommend.
reviews.title: great little place near attractions

reviews.text: Good restaurants . My friend is gluten-free and the restaurant on the corner across the street offers a gluten-free menu. The other wonderful restaurant is the Sarnic Cistern by the Topkapi Palace. .
reviews.title: The best!

reviews.text: We were traveling in Turkey for 15 days, in Oct. and Nov., and without a doubt, this was our favorite hotel. It wasn't the fanciest room, but it was so comfortable and clean. Oner and the rest of the staff were wonderful. Breakfast is unbelievable- fresh honey on yogurt, melons that were perfectly ripe, eggs to order, and a variety of breads...I would have been happy to start my day there for the remainder of the vacation. The location was perfect- a few blocks up to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia, and minutes to a selection of outdoor patio restaurants. We loved walking everywhere from the hotel- shops, the boardwalk along the waterfront, up to the top of the hill for tea above the Bosphorus...Each time we checked into another hotel, we would sigh and say "It isn't the Sapphire." Highly recommended by a long time international traveler-

reviews.text: This hotel was perfectly situated in the heart of the old town of Istanbul within walking distance of the main attractions, the tram system and the Bosphorous - very easy to get around Istanbul. The hotel was spotlessly clean and the staff very friendly and welcoming. Breakfast was a feast. Our room was spacious and comfortable and the bathroom adequate, although the shower was difficult to access because of the style of the shower screen. There were plenty of shops and restaurants close by and I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wishing a visit to Istanbul. We visited in July which was perhaps the wrong month because of the soaring temperatures. It was just too hot to wander around - but we did and thoroughly enjoyed the experience.
reviews.title: Best hotel in Istanbul

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sapphire was our first hotel in istanbul, great location in a very pretty cobble stone street with vines covering part of it, good restaurants close by, best breakfast we had in 6 weeks in Turkey, a large buffet which started early which is good as many hotels start way too late for those of us who want to beat the tour buses.Check when the omeletes are served as we liked to leave early and missed them as I think it was about 8 We are fit seniors and walked to all the hot spots during our 4 day stay including Topkaki Palace, Aya Sophia, Blue Mosque, Spice Bazaar, the Eminou where the ferry boats leave. Find the tram line and just follow. It is very easy to find your way around istanbul.
reviews.title: nice welcome to istanbul

reviews.text: From the emails prior to our leaving home, the pickup at the airport and the greeting at the hotel all was really great. The guys at the front desk were so funny and helpful. We enjoyed them immensely. The hotel is neat tidy and clean located in the old district . The rooms aren't huge but eveything in them is well kept. The breakfast is good but don't go late as there is not much left and the omelette guy has gone.
